author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Coca-Cola’s Super Bowl ad celebrates what makes America beautiful
text:
Sunday, February 5, 2017, 9:53 PM 
America is already great, Coca-Cola showed in a heartwarming Super Bowl commercial Sunday night. 
The 60-second spot, which first aired in 2014, was backed by a multilingual rendition of “America the Beautiful” behind video of dozens of people around the country living their everyday lives. 
The lyrics were sung in English, Spanish, Keres, Tagalog, Hindi, Senegalese, French and Hebrew and expressed a strong message of diversity. Coca-Cola’s “It's Beautiful” ad shows families and individuals from different backgrounds across the country. (Coca-Cola via YouTube) 
“The premise of ‘It’s Beautiful’ can be simply stated: America is Beautiful and Coca-Cola is for everyone. It celebrates Coca-Cola moments among all Americans and features snapshots of American families,” Coca-Cola said in a statement. 
“We believe it’s a powerful ad that promotes optimism, inclusion and celebrates humanity – values that are core to Coca-Cola. 'It’s Beautiful' shows just a few of the ways Americans enjoy our brand and how Coca-Cola brings families and friends together every day.” “America the Beautiful” is sung in English, Spanish, Keres, Tagalog, Hindi, Senegalese, French and Hebrew in the background. (Coca-Cola via YouTube)
